pullRequest.body:
The category-theoretic results can be split between `Mathlib/Algebra/Category/Grp/Injective.lean` and `Mathlib/Algebra/Category/ModuleCat/Injective.lean` instead, with no changes to downstream proofs.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

nodes.body:
### PR summary [5f2b32740a](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/17747/commits/5f2b32740a2d35d58deff78ca9ae56ebdf4ada3b)

<details><summary>

#### Import changes for modified files

</summary>

Dependency changes

| File | Base Count | Head Count | Change |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mathlib.Algebra.Category.ModuleCat.Injective | 1495 | 1178 | -317 (-21.20%) |
| Mathlib.Algebra.Module.Injective | 1044 | 872 | -172 (-16.48%) |
| Mathlib.Algebra.Module.CharacterModule | 1430 | 1429 | -1 (-0.07%) |


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Algebra.Category.ModuleCat.Injective`|-317|
| `Mathlib.Algebra.Module.Injective`|-172|
|<details><summary>12 files</summary> `Mathlib.RingTheory.Flat.Basic` `Mathlib.RingTheory.Regular.RegularSequence` `Mathlib.RingTheory.Unramified.Field` `Mathlib.RingTheory.Regular.IsSMulRegular` `Mathlib.RingTheory.Flat.Algebra` `Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.LinearDisjoint` `Mathlib.RingTheory.Flat.FaithfullyFlat` `Mathlib.Algebra.Module.CharacterModule` `Mathlib.RingTheory.Flat.EquationalCriterion` `Mathlib.RingTheory.LocalRing.Module` `Mathlib.RingTheory.Flat.Stability` `Mathlib.RingTheory.Unramified.Finite`</details>|-1|
| `Mathlib.Algebra.Category.Grp.EnoughInjectives` `Mathlib.Algebra.Category.Grp.Injective`|1|
| `Mathlib.Algebra.Category.ModuleCat.EnoughInjectives`|1496|

</details>

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Baer.of_divisible`
`+ ModuleCat.ulift_injective_of_injective.{v'}`
`+ injective_iff_injective_object`
`+ injective_module_of_injective_object`
`+ injective_object_of_injective_module`
`- Module.Baer.of_divisible`
`- Module.injective_iff_injective_object`
`- Module.injective_module_of_injective_object`
`- Module.injective_object_of_injective_module`
`- ModuleCat.ulift_injective_of_injective`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

Maybe we should create another file for these results, just like [the case of projective modules](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Category/ModuleCat/Projective.html). These results are basically by definition and shouldn't require so many irrelevant imports.

Note that there is an asymmetry between the projective and injective APIs, which is that `Module.Projective` is equivalent to the universe polymorphic lifting property (stronger than `CategoryTheory.Projective`), while `Module.Injective` is only the lifting property in the universe of the module (equivalent to `CategoryTheory.Injective`). For this reason, [IsProjective.iff_projective](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Category/ModuleCat/Projective.html#IsProjective.iff_projective) requires `P : Type (max u v)`, and [Module.Injective.extension_property](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Module/Injective.html#Module.Injective.extension_property) has a `Small` assumption. Arguably, the real analogue of [Module.projective_lifting_property](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Module/Projective.html#Module.projective_lifting_property) should be [Module.Baer.extension_property](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Module/Injective.html#Module.Baer.extension_property), where `Module.Baer` is equivalent to the universe polymorphic extension property. For this reason, instead of providing instances of `Module.Injective`, we should probably make `Module.Baer` a class and provide instances of it.

cc @jjaassoonn

> Maybe we should create another file for these results, just like [the case of projective modules](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Category/ModuleCat/Projective.html).

`Mathlib/Algebra/Category/ModuleCat/Injective` already exists, and is part of this PR. It contains a comment at the top of the file explaining why these results cannot live there.

Thanks for pointing out that the file exists; however the file should probably be renamed `EnoughInjectives` and we could make the `Injective` file contain only these three results (and hopefully, import only Algebra/Module/Injective.lean and CategoryTheory/Preadditive/Injective.lean). The docstring talks about enough injectives and I don't think it has anything to do with these three results.
You might add an `assert_not_exists` to this file
I think this shouldn't be moved, and then this file will need very few imports.

pullRequest.title: chore: do not depend on CategoryTheory in Module.Injective

source.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: generalize `LinearMap.exists_rightInverse_of_surjective` to projective modules
